com.gf.controller

Class ConfigurationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gf.controller.ConfigurationController

  • public final class ConfigurationController
extends Object
    Esta clase esta sacada de uno de mis proyectos privados por lo cual su javadoc esta en ingles
    Author:
    Adrian MRV. aka AMRV || Ansuz

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ConfigurationController.ConfigurationControllerListener
      A functional interface that will be used as a notifier for any changes on the configuration.

      Performs the given action for each element of the Iterable until all elements have been processed or the action throws an exception.
      String getConfig(String key)
      Gets the value of the given configuration key, will return an empty string if no value is found.

      Gets the value of the given configuration key, if no key is found, it will set the default value for that key and also return it.

      Gets the list containing every ConfigurationControllerListener the configuration is notifing.

      Checks if the configuration will notify the given listener about any changes.
      void reload()
      Reads the data from the configuration file
      void removeListener(ConfigurationController.ConfigurationControllerListener listener)
      Removes a listener from the configuration so it will no longer recive notifications when any value is changed.
      boolean save()
      Saves the stored configuration to a file and returns the result of the operation, will also send any error messages that occur even if the program continues working normally.
      boolean setConfig(String key, String value)
      Replaces the value of given key with any value, this will trigger all ConfigurationControllerListener, however this will only occur when the value is changed, so if the replacement value is the same as the previous one the configuration will not change.
      void setDefault(String key, String value)
      Sets a default configuration so if the key does not exist it will hold the given value and will also trigger the ConfigurationControllerListeners, however if the configuration already contains a value for the given key it will simply do nothing.

      • getDefaultImage

        public BufferedImage getDefaultImage(int width,
                                     int height)
        Obtiene la imagen por defecto de la aplicacion que será usada en caso de que no se pueda obtener una imagen concreta
        Parameters:
        width - ancho de la imagen
        height - alto de la imagen
        Returns:
        la imagen por defecto con las dimensiones especificadas

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
        Checks if the configuration file exists and can be read.
        Returns:
        true if the configuration file exists, false otherwise

      • setDefault

        public void setDefault(String key,
                       String value)
        Sets a default configuration so if the key does not exist it will hold the given value and will also trigger the ConfigurationControllerListeners, however if the configuration already contains a value for the given key it will simply do nothing.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the configuration
        value - the value of the configuration

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Reads the data from the configuration file

      • hasConfig

        public boolean hasConfig(String key)
        Checks if the previously read data contains the given configuration key.
        Parameters:
        key - configuration key to be check
        Returns:
        true if the loaded data contains a value for the key, false otherwise

      • getConfig

        public String getConfig(String key)
        Gets the value of the given configuration key, will return an empty string if no value is found.
        Parameters:
        key - configuration key to be check
        Returns:
        the value of that configuration key or an empty string if no value is found

      • getDefaultConfig

        public String getDefaultConfig(String key,
                               String defaultValue)
        Gets the value of the given configuration key, if no key is found, it will set the default value for that key and also return it.
        Parameters:
        key - configuration key to be check
        defaultValue - value that will be set and returned if no configuration is found
        Returns:
        the value of that configuration or the defaultValue

      • setConfig

        public boolean setConfig(String key,
                         String value)
        Replaces the value of given key with any value, this will trigger all ConfigurationControllerListener, however this will only occur when the value is changed, so if the replacement value is the same as the previous one the configuration will not change.
        Parameters:
        key - the configuration key
        value - the value to be replaced with
        Returns:
        true if the configuration was set, false otherwise

      • forEach

        public void forEach(BiConsumer<? super String,? super String> action)
        Performs the given action for each entry in this map until all entries have been processed or the action throws an exception.Unless otherwise specified by the implementing class, actions are performed in the order of entry set iteration (if an iteration order is specified.) Exceptions thrown by the action are relayed to the caller. The default implementation is equivalent to, for this map: 
         
 for (Map.Entry<K, V> entry : map.entrySet())
     action.accept(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
        The default implementation makes no guarantees about synchronization or atomicity properties of this method. Any implementation providing atomicity guarantees must override this method and document its concurrency properties.
        Parameters:
        action - The action to be performed for each entry
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified action is null
        Since:
        1.8

      • entrySet

        public Set<Map.Entry<String,String>> entrySet()
        Returns a Set view of the mappings contained in this map. The set is backed by the map, so changes to the map are reflected in the set, and vice-versa. If the map is modified while an iteration over the set is in progress (except through the iterator's own remove operation, or through the setValue operation on a map entry returned by the iterator) the results of the iteration are undefined. The set supports element removal, which removes the corresponding mapping from the map, via the Iterator.remove, Set.remove, removeAll, retainAll and clear operations. It does not support the add or addAll operations.
        Returns:
        a set view of the mappings contained in this map

      • addListener

        public void addListener(ConfigurationController.ConfigurationControllerListener listener)
        Adds a listener to the configuration so it will be notified of any changes in the configuration.
        Parameters:
        listener - the ConfigurationControllerListener to be added

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(ConfigurationController.ConfigurationControllerListener listener)
        Removes a listener from the configuration so it will no longer recive notifications when any value is changed.
        Parameters:
        listener - the ConfigurationControllerListener to be removed

      • hasListener

        public boolean hasListener(ConfigurationController.ConfigurationControllerListener listener)
        Checks if the configuration will notify the given listener about any changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - the ConfigurationControllerListener to be check
        Returns:
        true if the configuration will notify the listener, false otherwise

      • forEach

        public void forEach(Consumer<? super ConfigurationController.ConfigurationControllerListener> action)
        Performs the given action for each element of the Iterable until all elements have been processed or the action throws an exception. Actions are performed in the order of iteration, if that order is specified. Exceptions thrown by the action are relayed to the caller.

        The behavior of this method is unspecified if the action performs side-effects that modify the underlying source of elements, unless an overriding class has specified a concurrent modification policy.

        The default implementation behaves as if: 

        
     for (T t : this)
         action.accept(t);
        Parameters:
        action - The action to be performed for each element
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified action is null
        Since:
        1.8

      • getListeners

        public List<ConfigurationController.ConfigurationControllerListener> getListeners()
        Gets the list containing every ConfigurationControllerListener the configuration is notifing.
        Returns:
        the list of ConfigurationControllerListeners

      • save

        public boolean save()
        Saves the stored configuration to a file and returns the result of the operation, will also send any error messages that occur even if the program continues working normally.
        Returns:
        true if the configuration was saved succesfully.
